column4: Can anyone help me. I upgraded to 12.10 and now my only display option is 640x480, it should be 1280x1024. I googled it and tried other suggestions to no avail.
Install proprietary drivers.
Go to System Settings;Software Sources;Additional Drivers tab. And install newest version driver for your graphics card.
thank you I will try that
Let me know if it works.
additional drivers tab is empty. how do I get it to recognize my graphics card?
What graphics card are you using?
AMD Radeon X300
Which Ubuntu? 32 bit or 64 bit?
http://www2.ati.com/drivers/linux/ati-driver-installer-9-3-x86.x86_64.run

Did you directly upgraded from 12.04? I think you should do fresh install, cause I had problems when I directly upgraded distribution. Did Ubuntu recognized and downloaded drivers on 12.04? Or this problem occurs only on 12.10?
I did upgrade from 12.04 and yes, I did have a problem with 12.04 .
Try going to that link I gave you to download ATI driver. If that wont solve the problem do it as I said before, fresh install.
Or problem even could be because of AMD's bad support for Linux drivers. I even had a problem back in Ubuntu 10.04 with my NVIDIA drivers.
is there such thing as the perfect set up for a ubuntu system? If there is, I may have to build one.
Did you try to download that driver from AMD's site?
Did you try to setup resolution? Go to dash and type "Displays".
the computer is still working hard, nothing in displays yet
Did you solve your problem?
still nothing. maybe I did it wrong but after the download I clicked on the file and it ran gedit for a long time but nothing seamed to happen afterwords
Try to do fresh install.
thanks for your help. fresh install here I come:(
Will you be tomorrow here too? So I can see if that will work and help out till you solve your problem.
